intro: Tambourissa rakotozafyi, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
